column1: #Text=Yesterday , 37-year old IndyCar Series driver Justin Wilson died of injuries sustained on Sunday during the ABC Supply 500 at Pocono Raceway .
#Text=With about twenty laps remaining in the race , Sage Karam , who had been leading the event , crashed into the turn 1 wall .

#Text=As Wilson approached the site of the crash , reportedly the nose cone from Karam 's car that had been airborne struck Wilson in the helmet ; Wilson 's car steered to the left and collided with the inside SAFER barrier .
#Text=The event was placed under the caution flag as safety workers extracted Wilson from his car .
#Text=Wilson was airlifted to Lehigh Valley Hospital in Allentown , Pennsylvania .
#Text=At 9 P.M. EST , INDYCAR released a statement , announcing that Wilson had suffered a severe head injury , was in critical condition and had fallen into a coma .
#Text=The following day , Indianapolis Motor Speedway president Doug Boles and Hulman & Company Mark Miles officially announced Wilson 's death .
#Text=Karam was able to walk away from the accident , and was evaluated for a right foot injury ; he was released from the hospital the same day .
#Text=Wilson 's Andretti Autosport teammate Ryan Hunter-Reay won the race , though he did not celebrate upon finding out about Wilson 's accident .

#Text=A further question raised had been regarding Wilson 's height : at 6 feet , 3.5 inches ( 1.92 m ) tall , Wilson was the tallest IndyCar Series driver ; however , driver Josef Newgarden refuted the statement , saying ,  They make a regulation for how tall you can be inside the car sitting compared to the roll hoop [ ... ]
